storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my schedule for the week to manage my time effectively.

functional.title: Verify employee can successfully view their current week schedule with all shift details
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least 3 shifts scheduled for the current week
User is on the login page of the web interface
Schedule database is accessible and contains current week data

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials (username: 'emp001@company.com', password: 'ValidPass123') and click 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the employee dashboard

steps.action: Click on 'My Schedule' link in the main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads and displays the current week by default with week range shown (e.g., 'Jan 15 - Jan 21, 2024')

steps.action: Review the displayed schedule grid showing days of the week (Monday through Sunday)
steps.expectedResult: All scheduled shifts are displayed with complete details: shift start time, end time, duration, location/department, and any notes

steps.action: Verify each shift card shows color-coded status (e.g., confirmed shifts in green, pending in yellow)
steps.expectedResult: Each shift displays appropriate visual indicators and all information is clearly readable

steps.action: Check the total hours summary displayed at the bottom of the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Total scheduled hours for the week are calculated and displayed correctly (e.g., '40 hours scheduled')

postconditions: Employee remains logged in and on the schedule page
Schedule data is loaded and cached for quick subsequent access
User session is active and tracked in system logs
No data modifications have occurred

functional.title: Verify employee can filter schedule by selecting different weeks using date picker
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web interface
Employee is on the 'My Schedule' page viewing current week
Employee has shifts scheduled in multiple weeks (past and future)
Date picker component is functional and accessible

steps.action: Click on the 'Select Week' dropdown or date picker control at the top of the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Date picker opens showing a calendar view with current week highlighted

steps.action: Select a future week by clicking on a date 2 weeks ahead (e.g., click on Jan 29, 2024)
steps.expectedResult: Calendar updates selection and highlights the chosen week range

steps.action: Click 'Apply' or 'View Schedule' button to confirm the selection
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page refreshes and displays shifts for the selected week (Jan 29 - Feb 4, 2024) with loading indicator shown briefly

steps.action: Verify the week range header updates to show the selected week dates
steps.expectedResult: Header displays 'Week of Jan 29 - Feb 4, 2024' and all shifts for that week are shown

steps.action: Click 'Previous Week' arrow button to navigate to the week before
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to show the previous week (Jan 22 - Jan 28, 2024) with smooth transition

steps.action: Click 'Current Week' button to return to the present week
steps.expectedResult: Schedule resets to display current week with 'Current Week' label visible

postconditions: Selected week filter is maintained in session storage
User can navigate between weeks without losing authentication
Schedule view reflects the most recently selected week
API call logs show GET requests to /api/schedules/{employeeId}?week={weekDate}

steps.action: Click on the modified shift card to view full details

steps.action: Check for a notification banner at the top of the schedule page

steps.action: Click 'View Details' link in the notification banner

postconditions: Employee is aware of all schedule modifications

steps.action: Check if Employee A is redirected back to their own schedule page
steps.expectedResult: System automatically redirects to Employee A's schedule (/schedule?employeeId=emp001) within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify security event is logged in system audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized access attempt is logged with timestamp, user ID, attempted resource, and IP address

postconditions: Employee A can only access their own schedule

userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:
This story exists to provide employees with a clear view of their upcoming work schedule, allowing them to plan personal activities accordingly.

CURRENT STATE:
Currently, employees may not have easy access to their schedules, leading to confusion and potential missed shifts.

DESIRED STATE:
Employees can easily view their schedules online, ensuring they are aware of their work commitments.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:
‚Ä¢ Display weekly schedule in a clear format
‚Ä¢ Allow filtering by specific dates
‚Ä¢ Highlight any changes to the schedule
‚Ä¢ Provide details on shift timings

USER INTERACTION FLOW:
1. Employee logs into the web interface.
2. Employee navigates to the schedule section.
3. Employee selects the week to view.
4. System displays the schedule for the selected week.
5. Employee reviews the schedule details.
6. Employee logs out.

TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:
‚Ä¢ Data source: Employee schedule database
‚Ä¢ Validation rules: Ensure only authorized employees can view their schedules
‚Ä¢ API endpoints: GET /api/schedules/{employeeId}
‚Ä¢ Security: Implement authentication and authorization checks
‚Ä¢ Performance: Load schedules within 2 seconds

OUT OF SCOPE:
‚Ä¢ Mobile application access to schedules

SUCCESS METRICS:
‚Ä¢ 90% of employees report satisfaction with schedule visibility.
acceptanceCriteria: The system displays the employee's schedule for the selected week accurately.
Employees can filter their schedules by week and view details without errors.
Any changes to the schedule are highlighted and easily identifiable.
The interface is responsive and works on various devices.
